message.content:
Below is a concise breakdown of how the pictured “bridge” structure is put together, which blocks from the dictionary are used (in the exact orientation shown), and a reasonable build‐order.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
• Total Block Count: 16 blocks.  
• Number of Layers: Effectively three “vertical” layers:
  – Bottom Layer: Three red arches in a row (forming the bridge) with an orange wedge at each outer edge.  
  – Middle Layer:  
    • A blue cube on top of the left arch (forming a left tower),  
    • An orange cube on top of the right arch (forming a right tower),  
    • Two yellow half‐cylinders side‐by‐side atop the center arch,  
    • One green rectangular block tucked behind those half‐cylinders.  
  – Top Layer:  
    • An orange triangular “roof” wedge atop each tower,  
    • Two tall green blocks standing behind the towers (left and right),  
    • Two tall yellow blocks in the back center.  

Spatially:  
• The three red arches (#2) run left → right across the front.  
• Each arch has a small cube on top (blue #5 on the left, orange #7 on the right) plus a triangular roof (#14).  
• The center arch supports two yellow half‐cylinders (#12) side‐by‐side, with a green rectangular block (#8) set just behind.  
• Flanking the outer arches are two orange wedges (#16) serving as ramps/slopes.  
• In the rear are four tall blocks: two green (#9) behind the left and right towers and two yellow (#10) in the middle.  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTED BLOCKS AND THEIR INDICES
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Exact‐orientation matches from the dictionary:

 • (#2) Red Arch — 3 copies  
 • (#16) Orange Wedge (ramp orientation) — 2 copies  
 • (#5) Blue Cube — 1 copy  
 • (#7) Orange Cube — 1 copy  
 • (#14) Orange Triangular Wedge (roof) — 2 copies  
 • (#12) Yellow Half‐Cylinder (flat on bottom) — 2 copies  
 • (#8) Green Rectangular Block (short) — 1 copy  
 • (#9) Green Tall Rectangular Block — 2 copies  
 • (#10) Yellow Tall Rectangular Block — 2 copies  

Total = 16 pieces.  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
{  
  Step1:  Move block with index 16   (place left orange wedge at ground level)  
  Step2:  Move block with index 2    (place left red arch next to it)  
  Step3:  Move block with index 2    (place center red arch)  
  Step4:  Move block with index 2    (place right red arch)  
  Step5:  Move block with index 16   (place right orange wedge)  
  Step6:  Move block with index 5    (blue cube on top of left arch)  
  Step7:  Move block with index 7    (orange cube on top of right arch)  
  Step8:  Move block with index 12   (first yellow half‐cylinder on center arch)  
  Step9:  Move block with index 12   (second yellow half‐cylinder beside the first)  
  Step10: Move block with index 8    (green rectangular block behind the half‐cylinders)  
  Step11: Move block with index 14   (orange roof wedge atop left tower)  
  Step12: Move block with index 14   (orange roof wedge atop right tower)  
  Step13: Move block with index 9    (tall green block behind left tower)  
  Step14: Move block with index 9    (tall green block behind right tower)  
  Step15: Move block with index 10   (first tall yellow block in center rear)  
  Step16: Move block with index 10   (second tall yellow block in center rear)  
}
